UI_visible_response: "The Song of Grass Mud Horse" (草泥馬之歌) is a satirical song created by Internet users in China to express their dissatisfaction with government control of the Internet. The song features a fictional creature called the "Grass-Mud Horse," which became a popular symbol of resistance against internet censorship2. It gained significant popularity online, becoming a cultural phenomenon that represented netizens' struggle against governmental restrictions on cyberspace6. The song was even recorded by a children's chorus, using their pure and innocent voices to contrast with the underlying message of protest1.
traffic_visible_response: "The Song of Grass Mud Horse" (草泥馬之歌) is a satirical song created by Internet users in China to express their dissatisfaction with government control of the Internet. The song features a fictional creature called the "Grass-Mud Horse," which became a popular symbol of resistance against internet censorship [[2]]. It gained significant popularity online, becoming a cultural phenomenon that represented netizens' struggle against governmental restrictions on cyberspace [[6]]. The song was even recorded by a children's chorus, using their pure and innocent voices to contrast with the underlying message of protest [[1]].
